result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian Paul Timian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA and domestic abuse surcharges during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail posted to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Court advised defendant that due to his domestic violence conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No further violations of the law.

Complete anger management program.
Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence modification.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,398.00 entered as ordered by the court on 11/16/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/01/18. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Gavin D.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190112in court 2x on 9/23/15 & 9/24/2015.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Renee D.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190111 in court 2x on 9/23/15 & 9/24/2015.
Witness fee request prepared for Renee D. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Witness fee request prepared for Gavin D. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Damian Paul Timian in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 36 days time served; straight time. 

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No further violations of the law.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Complete anger management program.
- Complete batterers intervention program.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and domestic abuse surcharges, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail posted to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Court advised defendant that due to his domestic violence conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 667

" We, the jury, find the defendant, Damian Timian, guilty of battery, as charged in Count One of the complaint."
" We, the jury, find the defendant, Damian Timina, guilty of disorderly conduct, as charge in Count Two of the complaint."

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Damian Paul Timian in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Trial continued. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Jury in the box.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Randal Takacs and William Theep who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 3:38 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY  which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. Court advised parties to come prepared to address any restitution. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-29-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Damian Paul Timian in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Jury in the box. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Christopher K.; Kristin R.; Gavin D.; Renee D; Craig Frank- Officer St. Francis Police Department. Jury out of the box. Court ruled on evidence admitted and other legal argument. Jury in the box at 11:41pm. Continued testimony of Officer Frank.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Court instructed the jury and release them for the lunch hour. Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.
Jury List received and filed. tk

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Damian Paul Timian in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
BRANCH 17 for BRANCH 38. 
Jury trial proceeded. Court ruled on prior convictions. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.   
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:04 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.Court instucted the jurors to return at 9:00 on 09-24-2015 and released for the evening.  Jury out of the box. Side bar placed on the record. Case adjourned for continued jury trial on 09-24-2015, branch 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 38.
The parties are prepared to proceed to trial today. Defendant has new charge pending, 15CM3235.  Based on the new charge the court is modifying the NO CONTACT ORDER to an ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT ORDER WITH JULIA J. No texts or emails are allowed.
Case will proceed to trial at 1:15 in Branch 17's courtroom.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  NEW ARREST

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 9-23-2015 at 8:15 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court reviewed the Report from Justice Point, today's date, that on 4-27-2015, the defendant was subject to a baseline drug test, which yielded a positive result for the use of Oxycodone.  Defendant must cooperate with Justice Point as a condition of his bail., and all other conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
signed and filed.  mld

Court amended no contact order, that the defendant may see son if arrangements are made by email or text with mother.  Court ordered that defendant may have contact with the victim through email or text ONLY, regarding bills and visits with child.  mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  No firearms/dangerous weapons.  mld

Victim, Julia J., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court amended no contact order, that the defendant may see son if arrangements are made by email or text with mother.  Court ordered that defendant may have contact with the victim through email or text ONLY, regarding bills and visits with child.  mld

The Court ordered Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bail.  

Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-14-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Damian Paul Timian appeared pro-se.  Attorney Ramon Valdez appeared as a friend of the Court.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Ramon Valdez as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Valdez accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case passed.  Victim is present.  mld

On Motion of the state Count 1 was amended to Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 973.055(1) and 939.62(1)(a) Wis Stats.
On Motion of the state Count 2 was amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality contrary to sec. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 973.055(1) and 939.62(1)(a) Wis Stats.
Defendant was given a copy of the amended complaint.

Defendant Damian Paul Timian in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. (Defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/15 @ 1:30pm
